div.a: COMMENCEMENT CEREMONY CLASS OF 2020 - Tuesday, May 19th at 7:00pm

span.p: For the first time ever our Commencement ceremony will be presented digitally to our community. I can assure you that Commencement is always the highlight of the year and the most important event we hold. We believe that this year’s ceremony will be more special than ever.
Please click here for the rationale leading to this decision and for more information on this virtual ceremony.
Please click here for all of our detailed plans to celebrate our 2020 Seniors.

a.title: Click to read more about: COMMENCEMENT CEREMONY CLASS OF 2020 - Tuesday, May 19th at 7:00pm

div.a: Read More about COMMENCEMENT CEREMONY CLASS OF 2020 - Tuesday, May 19th at 7:00pm

span.strong: A Community Working Together through the Stay-at-Home Order

span.p: A Message from Dr. Nichols
Black Tiger Families,

Thank you for working together with us as a community as we continue to navigate these uncertain times. Our Black Tiger Family is strong, and we have been impressed by the way in which families are supporting their children every day.

span.span: Click here for updated information on the District Approach (Arabic and Nepali translations available)

span.p: CLICK HERE to access important links for student work lunch information, etc.

a.title: Click to read more about: COVID-19 DISTRICT UPDATE

div.a: Read More about COVID-19 DISTRICT UPDATE

p.span:
Click here to view the high school's summer session
brochure for general education, Cuyahoga Falls high
school students. The student sign-up link* is located
within the brochure. (There is also an option to fill out
and mail the form.)

span.p: We would like to remind everyone that we will be having meal bus stops from 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m., Monday, April 27 at the following sites:

Studio City Apartments on Winter Parkway
The Quirk Cultural Center
Hunter's Lake Apartments (near the office building)
The lot on Bailey Rd. and Monroe Falls Ave.; and,
The Sanctuary - church on North Moreland and Sedro
Each child will receive one weeks' worth of breakfast and lunch at these sites.
We also have meal pickup at all elementary buildings (except Silver Lake) as well as the high school open from 10:30 a.m to 12:30 p.m. daily.

Be reminded that all meals are free for any child 18 and under. You do not have to fill out any forms. If desired, weekly bag pickups are available at the building sites. If you have any questions, please contact our Nutrition and Food Service Supervisor Chef Bill Bailey at 330-690-4271.

a.title: Click to read more about: FOOD DISTRIBUTION UPDATE - 4/23

div.a: Read More about FOOD DISTRIBUTION UPDATE - 4/23

span.strong: The Cuyahoga Falls City Schools will be closed for students until the end of the school year.

span.p: Dear Black Tiger Families,

At this time, student safety and learning remain a priority. While we navigate these times, principals and teachers will make every effort to communicate with every family. CLICK HERE for information about Educational Expectations for Students.
CLICK HERE to access important links for student work lunch information, etc. for April 6 and beyond.
Go Black Tigers!

a.title: Click to read more about: COVID-19 District Update - Student Learning

div.a: Read More about COVID-19 District Update - Student Learning
TIGER BAG PROGRAM WEEKLY UPDATE - April 20 --Friday Breakfast, Lunch, & Dinner

strong.img: Click here to view flyer added 4/21

p.span: What is the Cuyahoga Falls Community-Wide Tiger Bag Program? It is a program that started at Silver Lake School 5 years ago and has grown to other buildings in different forms. Our Tiger Bag Program is now open to ALL Cuyahoga Falls City School students from K-12. We offer “Tiger Bags” every Friday that include 2 breakfast, 2 lunch, and 2 dinners. We continue to receive monetary donations that help us to purchase food from the Akron-Canton Food Bank.

span.span: Click here to register your request

p.strong: Cuyahoga Falls City School’s Music Education Program Receives National Recognition

span.p: Cuyahoga Falls City Schools has been honored with the Best Communities for Music Education designation from The NAMM Foundation for its outstanding commitment to music education. This is the third year in a row Cuyahoga Falls City Schools and the thirteen music faculty members have earned this recognition.

span.span: Click here to read all the details

a.title: Click to read more about: GOOD NEWS

div.a: Cuyahoga Falls Tech Dept. "drive up window" for repair and distribution

p.strong: The Cuyahoga Falls City Schools Tech. Dept. "Drive-Up" -- THIS IS AT CFHS.
We are no longer distributing or collecting repairs at the other schools

span.p: The Technology Dept. is working to centralize the pick-up and delivery of Chromebooks, especially units needing repairs.
If your student's school-issued Chromebook is not working, you can drop it off and pick up a replacement loaner.
OR, if your student still needs technology, but did not pick it up,
During the COVID-19 crisis we have limited staff available and will be doing our best to limit human to human interaction.
Fill out the form FIRST, we will not be able to assist any "walk ups" . Follow those instructions.

strong.em: We cannot fulfill your need without the completed form.

span.p: This week's schedule for the "drive-up" window:

a.title: Click to read more about: Cuyahoga Falls Tech Dept. "drive up window" for repair and distribution

div.a: Read More about Cuyahoga Falls Tech Dept. "drive up window" for repair and distribution

p.strong: is an online collection of technology resources for learners of every age.

span.p: Tiger One for All is a collection of links and online resources collected to one webpage by the Media Specialists and Classroom Technology Integration Specialists for the purpose of sharing basic ideas, methods and safety concerns when using technology for education. This is a resource for all of our community as we continue through this period of "stay at home" orders for the sake of the health of our community.

For a richer explanation of Tiger One for All, click on the podcast at the bottom of the page, for CFHS student DJ's interview with Alex Oris, Computer Technology Integration Specialist at Bolich and Roberts Middle Schools.
Please note: this is Not the website for specific curriculum and classroom assignments; parents should login to Progressbook or Google Classroom for that materials as it applies to your student.

As part of the COVID-19 school closings, staff are starting to receive many emails requesting student information. Cuyahoga Falls City Schools is required by both Federal Law - Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) and Ohio Revised Code 3319.321 Confidentiality, to maintain a high standard of privacy regarding student records.

With that in mind, Parents/guardians are reminded that the Only email address staff are only allowed to respond to,regarding student information, is the one listed in Progressbook/DASL. Many parents/guardians are working from home and often are already in a work account when a question comes to mind.
Please switch to the email account associated with your child's Progressbook account. before sending.
